merge.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing
merge.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
The bank announced that it was to merge with another of the high street banks.
proposals to merge the three existing health authorities into one
The villages have grown and merged together over the years.
merge.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if two things merge, or if one thing merges into another, you cannot clearly see them, hear them etc as separate things
merge.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She avoided reporters at the airport by merging into the crowds.
Memories seemed to merge with reality.
merge.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if two or more companies, organizations etc merge, or if they are merged, they join together
merge.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The companies will merge their cellular phone operations, forming one of the nation’s largest regional systems.
Sanford shares jumped 10½ to 35 after the company agreed to merge with Newell Co. in a stock swap.
merge.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to combine lists of information so that only one list remains
merge.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Before the company moved into the new location, we were responsible for merging as much information as possible.
